intro: Stanleya pinnata subsp. inyoensis, commonly known as the Inyo larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Its leaves are compound, with a pinnate structure, and it produces showy, spurred flowers that attract pollinators. This subspecies is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is a notable component of high-elevation ecosystems.
